intro: Dyschoriste crinita, commonly known as the hairy dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Dyschoriste crinita is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
